news.headline: Average UK rent climbs to £1,368 as house prices edge higher
news.summary: Average monthly private rents across the UK rose by 4% in the 12 months to December 2025. The annual increase was down from 4.4% in November and marked the lowest rate of rent inflation since May 2022. By contrast, average UK house prices increased by 2.5% in
news.article_text:
Average monthly private rents across the UK rose by 4% in the 12 months to December 2025, taking the typical rent to £1,368, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS).

The annual increase was down from 4.4% in November and marked the lowest rate of rent inflation since May 2022. By contrast, average UK house prices increased by 2.5% in the year to November 2025, lifting the typical price to £271,000. This was an acceleration from the annual growth of 1.9% recorded a month earlier.

news.article_text:
Healthcare provider stocks are falling out of favor as higher operating expenses and renewed debate over patient subsidies pressure earnings across the sector. news.headline: Average UK rent climbs to £1,368 as house prices edge higher
news.summary: Average monthly private rents across the UK rose by 4% in the 12 months to December 2025. The annual increase was down from 4.4% in November and marked the lowest rate of rent inflation since May 2022. By contrast, average UK house prices increased by 2.5% in
news.article_text:
Average monthly private rents across the UK rose by 4% in the 12 months to December 2025, taking the typical rent to £1,368, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS).

The annual increase was down from 4.4% in November and marked the lowest rate of rent inflation since May 2022. By contrast, average UK house prices increased by 2.5% in the year to November 2025, lifting the typical price to £271,000. This was an acceleration from the annual growth of 1.9% recorded a month earlier.

news.article_text:
By Rashika Singh

Jan 20 (Reuters) - U.S. IT hardware stocks dropped on Tuesday after Morgan Stanley downgraded the sector, warning of ​slowing demand as companies rein in spending amid economic ‌uncertainty and rising component costs.

The Wall Street brokerage said corporate technology leaders dialing back ‌hardware spending plans adds to existing concerns over higher input costs and supply bottlenecks, cutting its industry view to "cautious" from "in line."

news.headline: Netflix faces a murky outlook as it continues to pursue Warner Bros. Discovery
news.summary: Netflix (NFLX) will report earnings after the close of trading on Tuesday. The stock has plunged 15% since it announced its intent to buy Warner Brothers on Dec. 5. There is real concern that Netflix will guide 2026 profits below consensus.
news.article_text:
Some investors are tuning out of Netflix (NFLX), for now.

When Netflix reports earnings after the close of trading on Tuesday, investors will have to use both sides of their brains. And even then, there is no guarantee a logical conclusion on the stock will emerge.

While the fourth quarter is expected to be good on the back of strong content such as "Stranger Things" and "Squid Game," it may not be strong enough to offset investor concerns about Netflix buying legacy media outfit Warner Bros.

news.headline: Why Atlassian (TEAM) Stock Is Nosediving
news.summary: Citi reduced its price target on Atlassian's stock to $210 from $240. Macquarie also lowered its target to $240 from $250. The concern over executive turnover was underscored by the retirement of two long-serving board members.
news.article_text:
What Happened?

Shares of collaboration software company Atlassian (NASDAQ:TEAM) fell 7.1% in the afternoon session after analysts trimmed their price targets, citing concerns about the company's financial model complexity and recent executive turnover.
